instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2663: What is 820-2663? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3226: What is 820-3226? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2663</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard/mouse
threads.message: Hi Guys I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3226</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no keyboard mouse. Tried with another keyboard and mouse, different working ones, same result. Goes to login screen and nothing works. Hardware test said there may be an issue with KBD/Mouse and Thunderbold. Mac had some liquid spill long ago and some IC dont look to good. I did check the Power to trackpad and keyboard, they have 3.3 as well as 3.42v. Also checked <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> and resistors around it, seems all OK. Could it be that a short in the Thunderbold circuit freezes the keyboard and mouse as well? They both use 3.3v S4, but I did not see the lines connect with KBD/TRPAD in boardview.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2663</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard/mouse
threads.message:
Found a little piece of metal inside the Thunderbold port, removed it but that didnt solve the issue KBD/TRPAD issue, Thunderbold warning in ASD is still there so I will check these ports first.

Edit: when i check power on L3200 and 3300 I get 3.3v, schematics says its 15v. It only comes high if a device is connected or how to troubleshoot this circuit? There is a short to ground on 1.05V TBT "CIO" Switch and missing 1.05v. Anyway this can relate to KBD/TRCPAD?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2663</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard/mouse
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2663</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3226</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?????  What?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2663</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard/mouse
threads.message: He probably means 3662, I am having the same issue coincidentally on the same model

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2663</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard/mouse
threads.message:
Forget about TBT.

Voltage on <RESISTOR>R4804</RESISTOR> both sides?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2663</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard/mouse
threads.message: Yes sorry for that <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-03 it was late :). <RESISTOR>R4804</RESISTOR> Pin 1 = 3.314 and pin 2 = 3.327

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2663</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard/mouse
threads.message: Check if KB/TP are listed under USB devices. See if any other USB devices are missing/not working. Could be dead <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> if everything else is ok. Check USB data lines to <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> too, <RESISTOR>R4801</RESISTOR>/02.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2663</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard/mouse
threads.message: Any luck? I'm still having the similar issue that you have after changing the <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> ic again, i also checked the resistors around pch

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2663</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard/mouse
threads.message: Hi, yes sorry for not com,ing back here, replaced <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> and it worked again, thanks Duke!
